intro: Tanacetum tirinense, commonly known as the Tirine tansy, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flower heads consist of both ray and disc florets, resembling a daisy. Tanacetum tirinense is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
